review_title: Great place to gain experience and grow
pros: This is a smaller company and it is a great place to learn. There are many opportunities to get involved on committees and work on special projects. If you have a great manager, you will love it here. Employees work with people who need help the most, which can be stressful but you know you are making a difference every day. Benefits are good and paid time off is very generous. The great managers are flexible with employees schedules and let you flex time if you have to leave early one day, you can make it up later.
cons: It is hard to get in, because a lot of the jobs require experience. Upper Management has great ideas, but take a long time to implement changes. Some managers are not good to work for, and despite repeated complaints, they are still in their jobs. It is hard to move ahead in some departments unless you have additional education. Nonprofit so the pay is low.

job_title: ID Case Manager for Advocacy in New Delhi
pros: I've only been here 3 months but in those few short months, I still believe I made the right decision in accepting my position.  ID Case Management is a job that never ends.  There are no days with absolutely nothing to do.  It's tough and demanding, something is always changing from day to day it seems.  However, when you have the good fortune to work with an amazing team of individuals, it can make an absolutely "mind-blowing" day all the worthwhile.  The folk I work with are hard-working, dedicated, committed and so giving of their time and experience.  Each person is gifted in her own way towards doing this job and I am grateful that each one of them has freely assisted, offered valuable advice, and supported me as I grow into this position. It's been a great start and I know greater days are ahead!!
cons: The first two weeks of training were very informative but so very much was given in the 2nd week that was more related to the daily responsibilities of the position.  With so much info given during that week, it really should have lasted another week, at least.  That training touched on a lot and that it was way too much to be cramped into a week.
